name: HRANA
description:
Hidden behind layers of a mural painting is a land of memories, longing and hope. Follow the journey of its terminal guest.

Hrana is a meditative audio-visual experience based on a hand painted landscape influenced heavily by the history-scarred region of the German-Bohemian borderlands, known as Sudetenland. 

As a culmination of my six-year studies on The Academy of Fine Arts in Prague it focuses primarily on the visuals and atmosphere. It is a game about transience and reconciliation. 

The work was made possible thanks to many people, including:

David Pohan – Programming and sound design

Anna Ruth – Vocals

Special thanks go to: Anna Ivanova, Václav Kříž, Daniel Hagan, Vladimír Kokolia, Eva Červená, Václava Křížová, Jan Kříž, Helena Bendová, Tomáš Pospiszyl, Michal Berlinger, Jan Chlup, Tomáš Oramus, Adam Wlazel and to the Academy of Fine Arts in Prague. 

I am also very grateful to everyone contributing a small donation for the game.
